Reviews.Title: “could have stayed a fortnight...”
Reviews.Author: rachel t
Reviews.Content: lovely service from the moment we walked towards the hotel and they called to us to stop..and they ran to us and carried our suitcases over the bridge, and upto our room, it really made us feel like invited guests! The room, bathroom supplies, and breakfast were all amazing. Staff went out of thier way to offer extra blankets if needed; a tourist guide, where they go to eat on the islands and locally; and wifi and internet connctins were frely and easil available. The only negative comment that any of my fussy family can come up with is that the sofa bed creaked..but the linen and cushions were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Frantastic stay at the Ca'Vendramin, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jackie R
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at end of February, for our 4 day stay in Venice. I booked via email after seeing the other positive reviews and I wasn't disappointed , it is a lovely hotel. Perfect location just a few minutes walk from the vaporetto stop at Ca'D'Oro. Within easy walking distance of all the main sights. The breakfast was very generous, lovely fresh pastries, fresh coffee, fruit and bacon and egg. Our room was very comfortable and beautifully decorated & good value for money. The staff were very friendly. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Thank you to the staff for making our holiday so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Something wrong with these reviews”
Reviews.Author: toomanyairmilez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably a 2.5 or 3 star, not a 4 star as advertised. It sits a little outside of everywhere you want to be, has old beds, and offers a very limited breakfast buffet. Sure, Venice hotels may offer less for more money than elsewhere in Italy, but Venice has far better options that this hotel at the same price. Staff, yes, were very friendly, the hotel was very clean, and it was in a good state of repair. Keep looking for a better option and you should find something better and in a better location. Not sure why this hotel has almost exclusively 5* reviews, I'm guessing that

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay here, just as excellent as it was the first time!”
Reviews.Author: Ariby_GM
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here again over the course of our holiday to celebrate our second anniversary, this time travelling with two more couples. We all stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and then again for another night before flying back home. We chose to stay the first 4 nights in the same room as last year which we highly recommend; the 'Double De Luxe Soppalco' room (please see our previous review for a more detailed review for this room), and booked the 'Junior Suite Capella' for our last night. Sadly, although we requested and received confirmation that the 'Capella' room was available we were informed upon arrival that this was no longer the case due to a honeymoon couple extending their stay. Fair enough we thought, they were on their honeymoon after all, and we were given the suite next door, we cannot remember the suite's name but it was room number 202. We weren't very impressed with this room, the size was very generous, decoration was very nice and the balcony over-looking the canal was beautiful but the bathroom was tiny in comparison to the one in the cheaper 'Double De Luxe Soppalco' room, and it only had a shower. The biggest problem with this suite however is that the wall which separates it and the 'Capella' suite next to it is paper thin. One can safely assume that the 'Capella' suite suffers the same problem, and whilst we would love to spend a night in that suite to appreciate the painted ceiling we cannot honestly recommend either of them because of this, especially as the excellent 'Double De Luxe Soppalco' room does not have this problem and is cheaper! Our fellow travelling couples chose to spend their stay in the 'Economy' and 'Classic' rooms, both of which we found to be a good enough size for those on a budget particularly as the 'Economy' room they stayed in also overlooked the canal. A good improvement over our first say here back in 2010 was the overall cleanliness of the rooms, if you look at our first review we scored 4 out of 5 for the cleanliness whereas we can now comfortably give it a 5 out of 5. Another plus was that the coffee offered during the morning breakfast buffet was much better! No idea if the hotel management read these reviews but if they do then thank you for listening to your customers! :) PS: We are going to be in Venice again in February 2012 and would have stayed here again but sadly there is no availability so weâ€™ve had to reluctantly book elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: nscementer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite with a painted ceiling. The room was great and big. The staff were very friendly. We easily walked from the train station to the hotel and all the sites in Venice. The breakfast in the morning was very good. There is not many rooms so book in advance. They are currently in the progress of adding more rooms. The hotel is on its' own small canal so nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: holiday09England_
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, personal and beautiful. The location is excellent, right on the edge of a small canal. just a 15 minute stroll through lovely streets filled with shops and restaurants to Rialto bridge. At night it's peaceful and the rooms are decorated a very high standard and very venetian in style. The breakfast was varied and plentiful. i would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Venetian hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: twankey
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this Hotel highly enough. WE had a massive room with Sofa , frescos on the ceiling . A massive bed , a view from our balcony over the canal; a small restaurant over the other side . Everything you needed impeccable service fantastic surroundings . Venice magnificent .. ... .Tip if you are looking for somewhere inexpensive for lunch try BREK apparently its a chain of Italian cafes . its self service ,large choice and very reasonable about 100yds from the Train station .. Just looks like a sandwich bar but there is a large area behind to eat .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Deb11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a couples trip to Florence & Venice. This is a very nice property that is close to everything but far enough off the tourist path to be quiet and peaceful. The rooms are large and very elegantly furnished unlike some of the other hotels we have stayed at in Venice. Our room had a balcony and overlooked the canal where we would have wine each evening. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nomad413
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I stayed at the Ca' Vendramin di Santa Fosca for three nights in October. The hotel was fairly easy to find and is mid-way betweeen two Vaparetto stops, making it accessible, even when dragging suitcases. Upon arrival, we were quickly checked in and the staff insisted on carrying our luggage up the 37 steps to the second floor. There is no lift, but there was a standard chair lift for those who cannot manage the stairs. The room was lovely, spacious and great value. We stayed in one of the junior suites, which contained two twin beds pushed together and a chaise lounge made into a very comfortable bed. The floors were original, and came with the charm of period details. There were also two chairs, a desk and a little coffee table in the room. The views from the room where nothing special, but I did not travel to Venice to see it through a window! Breakfast was standard continental, but the staff was very attentive and made specialty coffees for the guests, including cappuchinos with little smiley faces. The staff was also available to make dining reservations and recommendations, which was greatly appreciated. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to the two closest Vaporetto stops and from there you can access anywhere in the city in short time. It is also great just to be able to walk out of the hotel and stroll along the streets. I highly recommend this hotel, and I booked through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Charming”
Reviews.Author: globalgirl3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Ca' Vendramin mid September for 3 nights. We booked a standard double room and it was lovely, wasn't sure what to expect as most reviewers recommend getting a suite but as we were on a bit of a budget opted for the standard room (we had the room where the bed is reflected in the antique mirror). The room was really nice, it overlooked a courtyard and the window was pretty high up so you had to stand on the bed to see out but the room itself was good, the bed and pillows comfortable and the bathroom was modern and clean with fresh towels daily. The hotel itself is situated just off the busy Strata Nova and once you cross the bridge to get to the hotel its so quiet and peaceful, you don't hear a sound so get a really good nights sleep after a busy day sightseeing. Some people have stated that its about half an hours walk to St. Mark's Square but we estimate 15-20 and you pass so many beautiful streets and squares and canals that you probably don't rush so it could take longer if your taking your time. But the hotel is quite central so we found it ideal. Breakfast was more than we expected with bacon, eggs, toast, cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurts, pastries and bread. Teas, coffees and juices all set in a small but elegant dining area. The hotel staff are outstanding and so friendly and helpful. You'll get a map on arrival and their knowledge is very good. We even had a bit of a history lesson from the night receptionist who told us the history of the building and Vendramin who owned the house. Be careful when ordering in restaurants, the food may appear quite reasonable but we sometimes got charged a service charge and a tax charge on top of your bill. Also the drinks are really expensive and 'bump up' your bill. e.g. 2 coffees 8 Euros and Spritz (local orange coloured drink) 5 Euros. We found it cheaper to order a litre/half litre of the house red at around 7 Euros for half a litre. Cannot recommend the hotel highly enough and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DrewFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ca' Vendramin during our weekend in Venice this September; we had signed up for the stay direclty on their website, and were excited by all the great reviews we had read here on T/A. Well, it did not disappoint! The best part about the hotel is its size -- I am pretty sure the concierge said that the hotel only had 11 rooms (maybe it was 14)... needless to say, the hotel never felt crowded or commercial -- it really felt romantic and intimate. The staff there were so great, they have to be mentioned in the review; upon check in, we were given a map and given details about getting around the city to see the important sites. In a place like Venice, that information was ultra-valuable because it is so vastly different from any normal city, with twists and turns and dead-ends. The standard room was large enough to be comfortable, with a nice bathroom. Everything in our room was spotless... the bed was large, there was a nice desk in room and an in-room safe and free wireless internet. Another great perk is that it is only 4 vaporetto stops from where the buses let you off so it is very convenient for getting to after long travel, and it is easy to get to the train station afterwards for departures around Italy. Our only negative feedback was that the bed was large but not overly comfortable -- the mattress was a bit stiff and the pillows were not overly soft either... but after walking all around Venice all day the softness of the bed isn't really that critical to deep sleeping! Lastly, breakfast was standard, good coffee and lots of continental fare that is standard around Italy. I can assure any readers I am not providing positive feedback for discounted services (which is always a worry of mine) -- my wife and I were thoroughly impressed and will most definitely be staying there again should we be so lucky to return to Venice some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelTHM
Reviews.Content: This is a great find in Venice (and I have stayed twice - July 2010/ April 2011). The hotel is very nice and reasonably priced, with helpful reception staff and a good choice at breakfast. The location is great as itâ€™s out of the main tourist area but still within easy walking distance of the Rialto Bridge/ market (10mins if you cross the canal on the Traghetto) and St Marks (20mins). The area has some nice bars and restaurants which are less expensive and more local. Would definitely recommend this hotel and bacaro jazz (bar/restaurant) on the way to St Marks for 241 cocktails during happy hour (touristy but fun all the same). If you are less keen on walking Iâ€™d recommend the vaporetto passes which will allow you to hop on hop off along the Grand Canal and over to the other islands (a trip to Murano is good fun, but make sure to check that the factories and museum are open before you go). We had a wonderful time staying at the ca' Vendramin.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alex15_001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only seconds away from the busy main streets, yet extremely calm and quiet at night. Perfect location, only about 30minutes walk from St Marc' square, and pretty much all places to visit in Venice. The reception were very good at giving us tips to eat, drink and visit places. We were even given a free ticket to see a glass making demonstration on the island of Murano which is definitely worth doing. All of which were extremely kind and generous. We stayed in the Junior Suite Capella which was an old (small) chapel, arriving directly from the airport and getting a little lost in the back streets of the gorgeous town of Venice (as I had mislaid the directions...) we however met some very nice locals telling us where to go. It would have been truly worth taking a water taxi from the airport directly to the hotel - something to do next time we go! The staff were extremely helpful and kind, always polite, always pleasant, always there no matter at what time of night. The room was very spacious, wonderfully decorated (although slightly faded I think it adds to the charm of a really old and beautiful Venetian room). Amenities were replenished daily, the whole room cleaned, and bed linen changed daily which is very nice. The room had a small Venetian style balcony over a canal, absolutely beautiful. Air conditioning was perfect, and the whole hotel looked absolutely lovely. Breakfast was very nice, many different options cereals, toasts, fresh fruit salads, fresh fruit, croissants, pain au chocolat... tea and coffees as well as hot chocolate made to order and so much more choice - although - no fresh orange juice (my only bad comment of our stay). Lovely breakfast. I would gladly go back - very nice, very lovely, truly worth the extra to get a junior suite. Just purely lovely.

Reviews.Title: “we absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: polarbear194
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 night with our 11 year old son. We stayed in the junior suite, it was beautiful, very clean, very spacious and right on the canal! with a wonderful balcony. we loved this hotel and will definitely be going back there. it's located in a beautiful part of Venice with great restaurants away from the main street, just a few minutes behind the hotel (do ask reception for recommendations, they are very helpful) Breakfast is continental, but with everything you need and the coffee and hot chocolate were very good. It's only about 10 minutes walk from the nearest water bus. the staff are really friendly,polite and very helpful. there's a supermarket a couple of minutes on the Strata nova and lots of sandwich shops so you can get picnic supplies if you wish. we ate one evening at the restaurant directly in front of the hotel, it was pretty average compared to all the other places we ate and they charge 2euro cover charge per person and add 10% service to your bill. a lot of places add service, but not all, and sometimes it's justified and sometimes it's not! as was the case with this restaurant. We ate at a restaurant a couple of bridges back behind the hotel on our last evening, i cant remember the name of the restaurant but it was JUST BEFORE restaurant Diane (next door). My son wanted pizza -again! we wanted somewhere with a menu with a bit more variety than the usual pizza&pasta. Brillliant ,they ordered a pizza from somewhere!! and it arrived to the kitchen, we saw it being delivered! our food was lovely, i had steak, my husband veal, both really beautifully cooked with very lightly roasted veg and my sons pizza was delicious. The wine was good, the setting perfect and our best meal in Venice. Do go on a gondola about 80euros, we thought it would be a bit cheesy, it wasnt. we loved the Peggy Guggenheim art collection. the Castello district on the way to the Arsenale gate was nice and quiet for walking around. But the best area for just walking and enjoying the magic of Venice is Cannaregio, the area around and behind this hotel. we think this hotel would be perfect for a honeymoon or anniversary as it has a very romantic feel.

Reviews.Title: “it gives good return for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ran-EvenYehuda
Reviews.Content: We were 4, got a big and nice room. Friendly staff. Tip - do not their advice for restaurants. They had good intentions but sent us to a restaurant which was not suitable for us, food-wise and cost-wise. Choose yourself :-). I definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with really good service and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Raji-Paji
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our second wedding aniversary with a trip to Venice, followed by a train ride to lake Garda for a night and on to Lake Como. We stayed at the Santa Fosca, which was walking distance from where the shuttle from the airport dropped us off. The hotel is located in the Cannaregio area and is situated in a lovely spot just over one of the canals.When we got there the lady at reception waslovely and let us check in early, gave us a map and showed us how to get to the vapporetti stop, the Rialto and San marco. The room was clean and decorated in a very extravagant, traditional manner . On leaving the hotel to see Venice, there was a new receptionist called Tilly ( Tilekeratne). He was a wonderful man, very knowledge able, polite and super helpful, he told us whereto go for dinner in an area behind the hotel less frequented by Tourists that gave us a wonderful experience of what locals live like in Venice and also told us we could get a Gondola for 50 cents the next day and go across to the fish market, which was also a unique experience, many thanks to him. All in all Venice was surreal, the place is like a dream or fairy tale, it does not seem real and is a must visit once in life, do the Gondola, go for a trip on the grand canal, and walk around and get enchanted.!. The hotel was lovely and all the people were lovely, the people ( Italian) were lovely through the rest of our trip, and I will be going to Italy again, it is the most beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: carolie_simpson
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with this Hotel and its location...We could walk anywhere, even with a 2 year old in a stroller. Loved our canal view rooms...the luxurious amenities (for Venice) and the historic location. It was a short walk to all the notable touristy locations, and in addition, we felt as if we were discovering the "real" Venice, and everywhere we looked was magical. We hired boat taxi's to and from the main canal so that we didn't have to lug our suitcases around at all.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this boutique hotel and its location”
Reviews.Author: car0lmc
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in the Ca' Vendramin. It is in a quiet area, although just off the Strada Nova, which is a shopping street with cafes etc. We didn't want to be in the main tourist area and this hotel is only about 10mins from Rialto and 20mins to San Marco, which we thought was perfect. The hotel is quite unique and beautifully presented with very helpful staff. We had a junior suite (Capella) and it was exactly like the photos on the hotel site. Plenty of space for a city hotel and comfortable with a balcony looking over a small canal. The canal did have traffic early in the morning but the noise wasn't too bad. The bathroom was small but adequate and clean. The dining area was lovely and breakfast was more substantial than we expected from a city hotel - cereals, fruit, bread/toast, cold meats and cheese, eggs and bacon, yoghurt etc. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so pleasant. We didn't see what the smaller rooms were like so I can't comment on them but our room was well worth the extra price. We like walking so walked everywhere but the hotel is only 5 minutes walk from a Vaporetto stop if you want to take a boat. We only had one mediocre meal in Venice on our arrival but I had checked out restaurants online before we went. We had booked Da Mamo near Rialto online and it was very reasonable (â‚¬90 for two - 3 courses each & a nice bottle of wine). Very friendly staff. It was very busy so booking definitely needed. We went to Algiubagio on our second night and the food was lovely and our waiter very helpful. It was expensive and also quiet on the night we were there. We went to the Da Rioba on our last night and would have gone back if we'd had another night. It was only about 5 minutes walk from the hotel and we sat beside the canal. The food was the best we had in Venice. Booking would be essential. Not cheap either but definitely worth a visit (you don't have to have 3 or 4 courses each!)

Reviews.Title: “One star room at 4 star location”
Reviews.Author: Anchier
Reviews.Content: First donâ€™t stay here if your room is not Junior Suite or Suite. There are a total of 11 rooms at the hotel. Only seven are Junior Suites or Suites. Good â€“ Federica at the front desk is friendly and very helpful. They have a very nice sitting room in the second floor with free internet access on a computer. Bathrooms have been remodeled. OK â€“ Breakfast. My husband skipped the second day and we left at 5:30 a.m. on the third day. You get the general assortment of eggs, meat, and rolls. Standard fare for a continental breakfast. Terrible â€“ The room was small, and there was very little space to move around. In fact, it was a U-shaped room, with a slender 3-meter walkway, leading to another slender 1.8-meter walkway, that led to where the bed was, and the bed took up most of the space in the sleeping area (you have to imagine that one of the arms of the U is thick enough to put a bed!). Also, the rooms were shaped in a 3D jigsaw pattern. So the bathroom from 103 seemed to be inside the â€œUâ€� portion of our room 104. The walls were thin. So, this wasnâ€™t pleasant in the mornings. I could smell the cologne of the man in 103. And we can hear foot steps over head. Our bathroom and shower space were small. In fact, my husband and I both kept banging are arms on the shower door while showering. The room itself could have used a paint job. There were splotchy places on the wall in one corner. The antique mirror was rusty with black spots everywhere. The high ceiling was pleasant to look at with its wooden beams. But, while admiring the beams I saw some dust and cobwebs. Two small rugs on the floor on either side of the bed were old and worn out. The room doesnâ€™t look half as clean as on the website. I slept in long pajamas because the bedspread was worn out and the room just didnâ€™t seem clean to me. I do want to mention that the hotel staff was extremely helpful in helping us navigate Venice, and enjoy our visitâ€¦and the location was very convenient for getting onto the streets and walkways to experience the city. A water-bus stop was relatively nearbyâ€¦and itâ€™s very easy to get around Venice once youâ€™ve been on the water-buses a couple of times. Close proximity to a very well stocked Billa grocery store was also a huge plus. The grocery store has prepared foods and salads you can eat in your room if you want to save some money. It can get expensive eating in restaurants for lunch and dinner. Weâ€™d give the staff 4-stars, the location 4-stars, but the room itself only 1-star, leading to a 2-star rating. I believe Hotel Ca Vendramin should post correct room images on their website so they donâ€™t mislead their potential guests. If youâ€™re planning on spending very little time in your room, and a lot of time out in Veniceâ€¦then I could recommend the locale in that light. Itâ€™s a place to store your stuff, munch on groceries, and sleep in a fantastic tourist locale. Youâ€™ll probably be disappointed in the room if you donâ€™t have a suite or junior suite.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - Very Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toojaysquared
Reviews.Content: We were hoping for a decent place to stay but were thrilled with the Ca' Vendramin. After hearing how expensive Venice is we assumed it would be an "okay" place. The hotel is so charming and the staff very helpful. Our room had a spacious entry way and bathroom and then had stairs up to the "loft" room above. The location is great - still in the heart of things but we preferred not being in San Marco or too central. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxurious period hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: TAmember33
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, and on reflection were glad that we chose to stay here rather than in a more conventional hotel (we nearly booked the Hilton Stucky). Location is a big plus - 20 min walk from St Mark's square / Rialto, 5 mins from Ca'Dor Vaporetto stop. Just off Strada Nova, a busy shopping thoroughfare with loads of decent restaurants. Might be an issue if you struggle to wheel your suitcase, but this is likely to be an issue for many hotels in Venice. We found the location to be great. In the thick of things but not right in the centre (which is a good thing in our book). We got from the airport to the hotel when we arrived and then from the hotel to the train station when we left, using only bus / vaporetto. All with minimal fuss. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. We paid for a junior suite and found it to be well worth the money. In Venice it just felt right to be in a big luxury period room with 20ft high ceilings and a balcony overlooking a side canal. Beautiful furniture and decor in our room and throughout the hotel. Yes the bathroom was small and the breakfast was only a nice continental (with basic bacon and eggs but great coffee), but this is truly a historic building - we overlooked the negatives and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in Venice. Finally, must mention one of the restaurants we ate on strada nova - straight out of the hotel and turn right on strada nova, its immediately on your left (small/cosy called something like trattoria de pecorino but can't remember exactly) Nice restaurant, good service!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel with a surprisingly beautiful interior in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: gearoidman
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with the lovely period room. The hotel was so accessible to the old city of Venice and the staff were pleasant and most helpful. The nearest public boat stop was only five minutes walk away, and the Rialto was a ten minute walk. Altogether to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venetian style hotel, fabulous rooms, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Ariby_GM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last leg of our anniversary...what a difference from our previous hotel! Entering hotel itself is very impressive, the chandeliers, staircase, high ceilings, and decor in general are amazing. Even more impressive though was the friendly service we received from check-in to check-out. We had booked the 'Double Classic' but were upgraded to the 'Double De Luxe Soppalco' room which was a nice surprise! Our room was split over two floors and was very spacious, and the bathroom had a hydro-massage bath, very welcome after walking the narrow streets of Venice for a day! The room did not have canal views, but the view of rooftops and the nearby garden was equally as pleasant. The room was spotlessly clean! The included continental style buffet breakfast was well presented and offered a variety of options, but the coffee could be better. Although a large building, the hotel only has 11 rooms which makes for a very relaxing stay due to the relatively few number of guests compared to other hotels. The hotel is located in the Cannaregio district, which may seem like it's too far from the major landmarks but in reality you are just a 10 minute walk away from the Rialto bridge. Do not let this discourage you, what you sacrifice in distance you gain in peace and tranquillity, and there are plenty of excellent local shops and restaurants in the area...for when you have had enough of all the tourist traps. We'd like to say thank you to all the staff who were so helpful and welcoming during our stay, and for advising us on local transport services and the good local Venetian restaurants. We will be visiting Venice again next year and we will stay here without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “No running water, HORRIBLE stay!”
Reviews.Author: apiggyinparis
Reviews.Content: The hotel had no running water our entire stay! The hotel would not compensate us in any way because they said it was due to no fault of their town. All They gave us was bottled water to wash up with. Unacceptable! The hotel also advertised AC. Our room had an AC unit, but it was not cool. We were given an old fan that did nothing but circulate the hot air. The staff was indifferent, although breakfast was decent. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth7887
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days/1-night in Venice last week and chose to stay at this hotel because of the reviews read on this site, and also for the great price we were able to find. Upon check-in, we were told that our room has been upgraded (we paid for the economy double), and that breakfast is included in our stay and is available from 7:45-10:30 AM. The hotel is beautiful and our room made us feel as though we were sleeping in a castle! The room was spotless too, and very comfortable. The Ca' D'Or Vaporetto stop is just a few minutes away, and the neighborhood was beautiful and safe. We would happily stay here again on our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “a gem”
Reviews.Author: Travel123456068
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be really authentic. It was nice and quiet, away from any 'touritsy' streets, the rooms were beautiful (read Venetian!) and the breakfast was plentiful. Everything was very clean. I highly reccommend this hotel to friends, who in turn have stayed there and echo my praise for the hotel. Stay in one of the suites if you can, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations in all respects”
Reviews.Author: bsmull
Reviews.Content: First, as one noted travel writer states, if you're going to Venice you simply have to be ready to "splurge". There's nothing about the city that's inexpensive, esp. at current exchange rates requiring as much as US$1.50 to the Euro. That said, our lodging experience at Vendramin was superb in every respect. This was a special occasional, and I wanted to treat my partner to something out of the ordinary, and Vendramin excelled in every respect. Front Desk service was always prompt and friendly, and included a *great* map of the city gratis. (Never underestimate the value of a good map in Venice!!) Our junior suite ("Cappella") had a large bay window and Juliet-style balcony opening onto the small canal fronting the west face of the building, with a view toward the church yard and bell tower beyond. Listening to the waterways come to life each morning was a memorable pleasure. As for other features, common spaces were nicely appointed, breakfasts were ample and high quality, and the hotel's provision of a desktop PC with internet access was an added bonus. For those coming from the airport, the reasonably economical but still scenic 'Alilaguna' waterbus worked quite well for us. Best to double check schedules/routes, but we used Linea ARANCIO (Orange Line) toward Rialto, disembarked at Madonna Dell'Orto and enjoyed the ~10 min walk southeastward along Strada Nova to the turnoff for the hotel, which is located another two minutes' walk off this major pedestrian thoroughfare. (Note: As cautioned in prior reviews, beware inaccurate directions to this hotel on some mapping programs--the hotel's website provides a coarse but accurate map.) Since our departure point was Venice's cruise terminal, we enjoyed this location a bit off the most heavily beaten path, which afforded nice opportunities for explorations on walks to/from San Marco etc. So assuming you're prepared to make the investment for a trip to this, one of the world's most beautiful and renowned cities, and looking for a botique-style hotel with good service and many artistic touches, I would certainly recommend Hotel Ca'Vendramin.

Reviews.Title: “Good all around, but maybe a bit overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: redfury
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the train station upon arrival and we were told that 120 Euros was a great deal for this hotel. It was in our price range so we booked for 2 nights. For that price we had a small room that was normally 120 Euros, maybe 160 Euros so don't look for any great deals at the train station (no kidding!). The hotel met all of our needs. Wifi was plug-in in room and very fast. Reception was outstanding and the breakfast was better than most. The location is quite good if you're looking for something quiet and somewhat central. There are many hotels closer to San Marco Square, but I would imagine they would have more noise issues. The walk was around 20-25mins through busy streets.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Peaceful Location”
Reviews.Author: ToWS
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time (a very long time) researching Venetian hotels and settled on the Ca' Vendramin, were we spent five nights in May 2009. We were very pleased with the choice and had a fabulous holiday. No, it's not on the Grand Canal, but that's not necessarily a drawback if, like us, you value peace and quiet (imagine staying at the Danielli and having Vaporettos mooring directly outside, night and day). It has a good location and is, for Venice, quite easy to find (Google maps has four entries for it, in four different places, the correct location is by the bridge on the Fondamenta del Forner). We stayed in the Suite Giorgione (the red room). We were also shown the Suite Vendramin (the white room), which is the room next door. Both of these rooms are on the front of the hotel and have the view across the canal to the Church of Santa Fosca and the Strada Nova. They are absolutely huge, beautifully finished and very comfortable. One drawback, the Suite Giorgione has a very small shower room, if you want a bath (with jacuzzi, no less) choose the Suite Vendramin instead. As others have said, the staff were very helpful and friendly, especially Tilly and Pauola.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: NightTrainLover
Reviews.Content: Exceeded expectations! Room was nice and clean...they even had a chandelier! This hotel used to be someone's home (Vendramin). We used the FREE internet upstairs in the Huge, Ornate Dining room. Federica at the front desk was so hospitable! She was so helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was amazing. I highly rec. this hotel! It is small and so comfortable. Right off the main road and close to everything (Between train station and Rialto). Used American Express points to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel met our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: alfsr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nites, Ist week of May. Booked a suite and it was just as the pictures indicated. Liked the fact that it is just off the main street and little foot traffic around the hotel. This is Venice so the size of the bathroom came as no surprize. The hotel is a converted private residence and has eleven rooms some are very small but the suites are more than ample. It's a little pricey but you get the feeling from the staff that your family. The free internet in the second floor former dining room is a real plus, access 24/7. The staff tries very hard to help you enjoy your stay,Tilly, Federica and Domingo stand out for being helpful. Breakfast buffet is more than adequate. Clean sheets and towels everyday with lotsa hot water for showers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay as a couple, close to main sites yet away from crouds”
Reviews.Author: DrBav
Reviews.Content: The main point was that the staff were very helpful, courteous and accomodating. The rooms were average sized, bit dark but comfortable. The walls however are thin - I could at one point here the neighbours snore! Breakfast is standard continental. The location of the hotel is good - it is just away from the crouds in a quiet area of Venice, yet only 15 mins walk to Rialto and 25 min to St Marks Square. The waterbus stop is only 5 mins away (Ca Doro). The only criticism is that at one point, when we returned, the doors were locked and we had to wait 5 mins before we could get in - this was a staffing issue and it somehow I don't think that it would happen again...! Overall a good, clean, friendly place to stay - we certainly would go there again if another Venice trip is on the cards!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: mattskelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Ca' Vendramin di Santa Fosca. This hotel is on the main island and we got a great deal...2 nights/$240. I have heard about people going to Venice many times and never staying on the island...this hotel was probably the best value of our entire trip. Breakfast was great, it was a buffet. Hotel seemed newly renovated and was very clean. We loved our room as well. Very Cozy! About a 20 minute walk from Piazza San Marcos.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Alip2264
Reviews.Content: Having run away to get married 6 months ago we decided to have a belated honeymoon in the romantic city of Venice. When it came to booking a hotel I knew exactly what I wanted - romance, peaceful setting, but not too far from the hustle of the city centre and most of all a room with a canal view and with just a week before we travelled, I found it! The hotel is beautiful and although we did push the boat out because it was our honeymoon I got the impression all of the rooms were lovely. Our suite (The Giorgione) overlooked the canal and had four floor to ceiling french doors making the room light and lovely, but cosy once the shutters were pulled shut. The ceiling was painted which was amazing and the walls were covered in fabric. The bathroom (shower room as there is no bath) was adequate (spotlessly clean, lots of lovely smellies and clean towels daily), but very small and not really in proportion with the room. But hey how much time do you spend in the bathroom anyway? The bed was very comfortable and the room has air conditioning and there was plenty of storage, two TVs (!), comfy sofa and a small fridge accommodating the minibar. The breakfast was very good with plenty on offer including fresh fruit, cereals, breads, jams, croissants and even some cooked bits (bacon and I think eggs). And the most delicious hot chocolate - yum! The staff, every one of them, were very lovely and eager to help in any way with directions, advice or booking restaurants etc - couldn't fault their attention to detail. There are shops and restaurants two minutes walk away and the vaporetto is five, but there is very little noise and the overall sense is one of tranquility. You can walk to the Rialto Bridge in 10 minutes and be in the centre of St Marks Square in 20 but the walk is lovely winding through little streets and crossing over canals and there are shops every step of the way! Overall we were very impressed with this hotel and should we ever return to Venice wouldn't hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, comfortable hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: DWSUK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The location is excellent - a pleasant, quiet canalside within a few steps of the lively Strada Nuova. Close by are several great little Venetian restaurants, away from the tourist crowds. Room was comfortable with air con and pleasant courtyard view. Delightful and helpful staff on the front desk who speak perfect English and are always happy to assist with advice and recommendations. Extremely good value, especially by comparison with the high prices of many Venice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but uncomfortable, expensive and hot!”
Reviews.Author: McFarR56
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to be staying at the Ca' Vendramin after reading all the reviews on TripAdvsor. The staff was pleasant upon arrival and showed us to the room we reserved, the classic double. It was a bit small, however that was not unexpected. They then offered to upgrade us to a junior suite for 'a small charge' (our small charge ended up being 100 Euros). We decided to go for it, since we're only in Venice once! The suite was gorgeous and the bathroom very clean. However, the bed was very hard and old. This could have been overlooked if it wasn't for the heat and lack of air circulation! We understood that it was July, however, the air conditioning didn't seem to work and the temp in the room couldn't have been lower than 80 degrees! We were sweating just standing in the room. There were no fans to circulate the air either, so we were forced to open the windows to get a breeze of cool air in the room. It was about 15 degrees cooler outside than in our room. Opening the windows, however, proved to be a fatal mistake! The mosquitos invaded with gusto. Neither of us got any sleep and were covered in bites. We ended up checking out of the hotel at 6:00AM and were surprised with our 100 Euro upgrade charge. Definitely NOT worth it! Honestly, I wouldn't book this hotel again, and I'm a frequent traveler. I stayed in a hotel in Milan that was only 3 stars (Hotel Mercure) and it far surpassed this hotel. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vic_and_Dom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first three nights of our honeymoon: May 5th - 8th 2008 and had specifically chosen the Giorgione Suite. It was everything I had hoped for. The room was huge with decadent Venetian decoration and furniture. The ceiling painting was impressive and the little balcony was a nice little look out onto a quiet canal. I'm glad we were here instead of on the Grand Canal as this is very busy with boats and would have probably been noiser. The bathroom is a little small, and only has a shower, as opposed to the Vendramin Suite which also has a bath, but it is well laid out and clean and it served it's purpose. I was able to look in the Vendramin Suite while it was being cleaned and saw that it was just as spacius, but the balcony looks out onto a square rather than a canal. The Vendramin Suite has white decor and the Giorgione Suite is red, which I, personally preferred for it's warmth and romance. The breakfast area is small, and the selection of pastries was not the best we found in all of Italy, but it was certainly enough to start the day. The staff was polite, smiley and welcoming. You can access the internet for free from a PC on the landing. I would definitely recommend this for honeymooners, particularly the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burscoboy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel. It is a very old Venetian grand house which has retained all of its architectural features and has been refurbished to a very high and comfortable standard. We stayed in a standard double room which was a good size with beautiful furnishings. The en-suite shower room was nicely decorated with marble throughout. If you wish to pay the extra then other grander rooms are available but we were very happy with our room. The staff were very welcoming, polite and helpful, Our room and the public areas were immaculately cleaned every day. The buffet style breakfast was well prepared with plenty of choice and quantity. It was served in grand surroundings by attentive staff. The hotel itself is very well positioned on a quiet side canal adjacent to a main street which gives easy and quick access to all the tourist spots. Great to escape the crowds in this peaceful and charming backwater but when you want to visit the highlights you are soon there - Rialto Bridge (10 mins) - St Marks (15mins). There are plenty of restaurants & cafes in the immediate area of the hotel. Thereâ€™s also a supermarket where the locals shop. The hotel is easy to find as it is only 3 minutes walk away from the Ca dâ€™Or vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal. I got the directions off the hotelâ€™s own website and went straight there (http://www.hotelcavendramin.it/en/location.htm) We enjoyed our trip to Venice but it was enhanced by our stay in the Hotel Ca'Vendramin di Santa Fosca which certainly gave you a sense of the history of the city. We would definitely recommend it and would have no hesitation whatsoever returning there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but the rest....”
Reviews.Author: ASCMMC
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel. Right on the water and very centrally located to the train station, Rialto Bridge, and St. Mark's Square. Excellent for taking a water taxi to or from the airport and the hotel was helpful setting that up for us and negotiating a great rate. But the rooms were small. Very tiny. We found a few bugs in our room and were often woken up by the next room's TV or people walking in the hallway (tile floors). Breakfast didn't start until 9 am on the days we were there which we found to be later than we'd have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: wendy_du_toit
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week-end at the Ca Vendramin in Venice. What a beautiful hotel with outstanding service !! All of the employees made me felt that I was their only guest for thye weekend, and that nothing is to much trouble for of them. My room was a bit small, but as I was there on my own & I spend hardly spend any time in my room , I cant say that it concern me at all. I have booked a single room - and I guess that is normal in Europe. The breakfast was excellent, pleant of food and great coffee. There is free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful palazzo, but beware of the ground floor”
Reviews.Author: Vtrocky
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property and the staff was extremely nice and helpful. However, the room that I was shown to at first turned out to be very small and depressing. I was offered another room next door, a superior double at a higher price, which I ended up taking not wishing to ruin my stay in Venice. This room turned out to be very comfortable, clean and had a great shower, but I think that it should have been offered to me at the same price as the first. That's the experience that I had at other hotels in Italy where I find they usually try to pawn off the worst rooms on women traveling alone. All the glowing reviews that I read about this hotel had to be about the rooms on the upper floor. The main floor rooms are basement-like and one is privy to EVERYTHING that is going on in the next room. Happily I had my earplugs. The breakfast was plentiful, but just ok. The coffee was not good, very unusual for Italy. And the computer upstairs needs a new keyboard. I probably would have been very happy with an upstairs room, and I loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: stedi
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Venice, celebrating our silver wedding anniversary. Chose this hotel based on looks and trip advisor ratings - great choice! Booked direct - prices better than most sites offering. Booking handled efficiently, got the capella suite which is what we wanted. Staff are excellent - friendly, and speak good English. Very helpful with suggestions for good places to eat. Restful atmosphere after hectic days of sightseeing. Very clean, beds comfortable, great choice at breakfast. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: JeremyHuang
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because my travel plan had to be changed and I couldn't get a room in the more popular hotels I had booked. Although it's not one of the top-10 hotels according to the popularity, Ca' Vendramin and its staff did not disappoint me. For the highlight of the last day of my trip I booked a suite for 360 euros and found it very spacious as well elegantly decorated. The suite has two balconies facing a quiet small canal and is equipped 2 LCD TVs and a bathroom with jacuzzi. And the ceiling of the suite is very exquisite. The staff of this hotel were welcoming and friendly, especially the porter was very hepful to inform me about the bus connection to the airport after he had heard my request for a watertaxi the next day. and then tow of the staff patiently searched the timetable of the bus for me. And another good thing is that there is a free internet point in the luxurious lounging area just outside the suites. Still, however, there was one shortage bothered me: the AC of the suite was quite loud during the night. But in Northern Italy Settember is a little bit chilled in the nights , this may not a problem if the window is opened. If the suite cost less than 250 euros, I'd give it the highest score - but since the hotel is in Venice,

Reviews.Title: “Live in style at Ca' Vendramin”
Reviews.Author: stargazer28
Reviews.Content: A very beautiful palazzo tucked away from the hurly-burly with excellent staff. Because it only has 11 rooms, it has a relaxed atmosphere. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable.. absolutly loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: brooke16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vendramin this past August for two nights. We arrived via train and decided to walk from the train station to the hotel which was about a 10-15 walk. The hotel is located on a small waterway over a little bridge, and is just beautiful. It was once a noblemans home and is decorated exceptionally. The front desk employees were all pleasant, helpful and spoke great English. We had booked the basic room which was small but decorated nicely in the traditional Venetian fashion and the AC worked great. The bed was turned down each day for us and the bathroom even provided Q tips which was a nice surprise. Slippers were also included. The breakfast was included and was more then crossiants and cheese.. they actually had eggs, which didnt matter to me but my boyfriend was thrilled. The location was perfect for us.. not right in the main tourist area but a short walk away.. although we did manage to get lost at least 2 times a day just because Venice's streets and waterways are very tricky.. but its all part if its charm. When I go back to Venice I will stay at this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great”
Reviews.Author: stakerk
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Modern rooms, lots of marble. Great hot breakfast. The hot chocolate is marvelous. Central location. Not cheap but a good value for what you get. Best of all was the service. We especially appreciated the day clerk, I believe her name is Carlotta. Very nice, could not have been more helpful. In fact, highly recommend you have her show you on the map where to stroll to get a feel for the real city. A great place!

Reviews.Title: “loved the santa fosca”
Reviews.Author: helenBiggles
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 10-13th September and loved it. The hotel is very nice and grand. The staff speak very good English and are extremely helpful. The hotel was very easy to get go by bus and water bus from the airport and very easy to find. The location of the hotel is excellent being 10 minutes walk to St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge yet very quiet for a good nights sleep. Breakfast was very pleasant and plenty of variety with very helpful yet discreet staff. The bar was good and you could always get a coffee if you popped back to the hotel. The beds are very comfortable and showers excellent with very good selection of toiletries. The little gift which we got when we left was very nice and a nice touch from a lovely hotel. Do go and check out the markets just off Rialto, take a boat ride a long the grand canal, we did get lost a couple of times but in such a lovely city you dont mind and the hotel give you a good map too.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. Location is good as it is within walking distance of all the major sights yet set on a quiet canal for a peaceful nights sleep. The boat taxi from the airport to the hotel door cost 90euro. The views coming into Venice this way at night were just beautiful. The parting gift from the hotel on check out was a lovely touch and a nice reminder of a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ca'Vendramin di Santa Fosca”
Reviews.Author: xxxlakerfan1
Reviews.Content: How can you not fall in love with Venice? First of all the Hotel was so wonderful. The staf was so friendly and helpul, full of helpful information and tips. The room was so comfortable and lovely. Upon arrival the lady behind the counter was very friendly and nice. The bed was so lovely and comfortable. There were shades that kept the sunlight out. room service was amazing. The room and bathroom were always clean! For example, when we checked in we freshened up a little took a shower and left for a few hours upon returning to our room, it was spotless again! Amazing, the service here. Every time we went out and came back it was tidied up again. The breakfast was amazing, I don't believe I've had a better breakfast at any hotels that we have stayed at before, and we have been to many different hotels in different countries and cities around the world! The location was also perfect. It was in a very queit location, but very close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Venice”
Reviews.Author: sbeny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Ca'Vendramin from June 29th to July 2nd. Location wise it was perfect. My husband and I like to walk a lot (or atleast I do and he comes along for the ride) and it was in the middle of all the districts so that we could really explore Venice and get out of the touristy hoardes. About a 10-15 minute walk to St. Marks, but more importantly if you want to get lost, stroll and see all the different districts it's about 10 minutes to the Rialto Bridge, 10 minutes to the Jewish Ghetto, 15 minutes to the train station, all by foot! Plus if you want to go to the fish market and don't feel like walking there is a .50 Euro Traghetto "a block" away that will take you across the canal in 1 minute. From the airport you can take the bus to the main station in Piazella Roma and then the Vaporetto to the stop Ca' Doro which is less than a 5 minute walk. Don't wait on the ticket line at the airport there is a machine right next to the bus stop. Water taxi's to me are overrated and not necessary as are Gondola's. If you want to get the boat experience at night, walk to St. Marks square at night, listen to the outdoor music and then then take a Vaporetto back to the hotel for like 12Euros sit in the front and enjoy the view. Anyway, back to the hotel. The location is very safe, it's off the main street so that there is no noise, it's close to lots of restaurants and bars if you want to enjoy Italian Tapas from place to place. The room is definately small. We stayed in a classic junior. The bed takes up most of the room you have a litlte bit of space on each side to walk and then the bathroom which is a good size and very clean. Despite how small it was the room was perfect for resting before dinner and getting a good night's sleep. What more do you really need! They could use an extra shelf to put your toiletries on in the bathroom, but it was really no big deal. Our hotel was on the first floor right next to the main desk and we never heard anything or were bothered by any noise. There is even a supermarket near the hotel to buy water for your trips around town. Breafast if fine, exactly what you need some cereal, breads, meats, coffee etc. The coffee was very good. Everyone was helpful, they provided us with a great map which you need in Venice and they also had the internet for free which was a nice bonus. All in all I would highly recommend this place. It is a little expensive 145Euros a night, but it's Venice and that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Small, good location. Cute, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Samk_7
Reviews.Content: Booked this for the wifes bday... Great location. It is small and our double room was not very large - but whats decent about the hotel is the detail and finishes. Expensive finishes to the materials. When we had breakfast we had good service from the staff - prob cause the hotel is small. Annoyingly all the satellite channels are in italian!!!!! Why the hell would only italians stay there?!? Arrogance.. (this may not be the hotels fault though - prob standard throughout italy??) No gym, pool etc - too small for that. So cute hotel, good location, but small rooms....but then the whole of venice is small...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find”
Reviews.Author: NYlovely-rita
Reviews.Content: We loved this charming hotel. The service was great. We had friends staying in another close by hotel so we could compare notes and we had by far the best deal. Their air conditioning went out at their hotel and they came over to our hotel for the night. They were impressed too. I loved the breakfast and the 2 towels a day which we used because we needed a shower after our daily sightseeing before dinner. We bought tickets to a Vivaldi concert through the front desk. That really made our life easier. They made arrangements for our 5:00 am water taxi to the airport and had breakfast waiting for us too. We did have one of the smaller rooms on the 1st floor but it wasn't noisy. We loved the gift - a small mask- on our check-out from the hotel. Great area of Venice-Cannaregio-and a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venitian delight”
Reviews.Author: DadimaK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Ca Vendramin based on the reviews we read on Trip Advisor. It was a complete delight. We arrived from the airport by water taxi( more like water limo) which was expensive, but completely worth the splurge. We arrived right at the door of the hotel where the desk manager came out, unloaded our bags and had our room ready for us in a matter of a few minutes. Our room was the smallest the hotel offers and perfectly fine for two people. It was also immaculately clean. The bathroom appeared as though it had just been completely renovated and the air conditioning worked beautifully( it was July). The physical comfort was matched only by the wonderful and helpful English speaking staff who treated us like welcome guests. The hotel is located about a ten minute walk from St. Marco and the crowds and noise. It was relaxing to walk through the quiet neighborhoods and stay where you can open the window in your room and hear the birds. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Venice... a world Gem”
Reviews.Author: j1nny7
Reviews.Content: This is a sensational Hotel in a breathtaking city. I promised myself that I will travel as much as possible and never return to somewhere I had already been... Venice and thi Hotel is without a doubt the exceptions! The hotel staff are amazingly helpful with a warm and welcoming demeanour, they change towels twice a day here! The location is fantastic, close to key areas but conveniently hid away for peaceful nights. The decor is breathtaking, check-in and check-out smooth. In one word... Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Perfect City!”
Reviews.Author: michael_scotland
Reviews.Content: Perfectly sited within a short distance from the Ca'Doro vaperetto stop, this is a lovely converted Ventian palazzo. The facilities are excellent (the towels were changed 2 a day!) and the staff could not be more helpful. All together a delightful experience in the most beautiful city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: leensarah
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay. the room was a standard double and was kept very clean and tidy with towels changed twice a day and beds turned down at night. A beautiful bathroom with lots of extra soaps shaving kits and even toothbrushes. The hotel is in a very good position,near all the major venitian sites. I would definatly return to this hotel .When we left ,the hotel very kindly gave me a bottle of asti, it was a lovely thought but I never put it in my suitcase for fear it would explode .So unfortunatly when I got to the airport it was seized by customs!. so maybe a box of chocolates would be a better idea.

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic experience”
Reviews.Author: Elaine36
Reviews.Content: This is the most charming hotel in central Venice. To arrive by water taxi is a must! The staff are super courteous and helpful, the breakfast is great and the location is location, location, location! We stayed in a junior suite - the capella, which was the most divine room, frescos on the ceiling and fabulous chandelier. This place is very quiet but only 5 mins walk from a vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic. great staff. good location. recommended without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: jan100
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, great location - about a 15-30 minute walk to st marks square. close to a vaporetto stop at ca' d'oro. We had the 'basic' room, which was small - but unlike alot of italian hotels (where we stayed in rome for instance) this was fantastically decorated,in a 'traditional' style, in good order, extremely clean with a very modern bathroom.(with all the extras you could ever want - toothbrush, shampoo, mini razor etc) . If you wish to pay a little more the rooms can get very ornate & grand..but the inexpensive route was fine for us - booked through expedia at a very good price. Staff were very polite, friendly and helpful at all times. Brekkie was included in the price - which was a very good continental style buffet, all fresh. there's a local 'supermarket' just round the corner and it's very close to all the restaurants you could ever want. Can't fault this hotel, would recommend without hesitation. Fantastic stay. Good location for your venice holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Manta77
Reviews.Content: This is a small but beautiful place - 11 rooms in all I believe. We booked out the entire place for a 2 day work trip and it was wonderful. The suites were above average, I had the frescoed room overlooking the canal shown on website which was stunning. However some of my colleagues were in the single or standard double which were small. This is Venice however, so it would be misplaced the compare size & cost to other cities. The service was faultless, we were well looked after for our meeting and given overall a great deal that made this a cheaper option than say where we would normally have a team meeting (eg Amsterdam airport hotel). The intimacy of a 16th century Venetian palazzo outweighed multiple times the small drawbacks that comes with a small venue. I was also made an enormous birthday cake because they noticed from my passport when I checked in it was my birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: E&Dontour
Reviews.Content: Good location - not in the dense tourist areas but just a short walk to the Rialto bridge. Nice local bars and restaurants in the immediate area. Rooms recently refurbished and the staff were very helpful indeed. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock8700
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in venice, well located and very helpfull stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to strayt in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: JCP75
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a quiet but pleasant area of Venice, 15 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge. Exactly what you'd expect from a typical Venetian palazzo: a limited number of beatiful rooms, a warm and nice welcome, original furniture, view over a canal, etc. We stayed in a suite and a junior suite. Great value for money ! Really a great place to stay. Eve & JC, Paris, France

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Pandai
Reviews.Content: A good hotel! Room was clean and presentable. The common area was very nicely decorated. Very good facilities overall - not to mention free internet for guests. The best part about this hotel is the extremely helpful staff. They went out of their way to research for shops or orchestra for us. The only criticisms we have are that the room we stayed in was very small - although we did get the cheaper room (I think it was a classic double) on the ground floor - and that the room was not very sound-proof. The conversation next door was clearly audible. Location wise, this is tucked away from the busy tourist areas such as St Marco and the Rialto, but it is still a short walking distance depending on how crowded the streets are. You could probably get to Rialto under 10 mins. For travellers who hate crowded places and want to go back to some place quiet, Cannaregio is the place to stay. The hotel is not far from the station, about 800 metres away. So don't get sucked into catching the water taxi (50 Euro). You could easily walk from the station.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ca' Vendramin di Santa Fosca
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 2400, 30121 Venice, Italy
